content.raw:
As we saw with simpleseg when developing the validation functions, an overly contrived test case may not work well with gmtkJT (that issue, resulting in needing to use actual data, is the reason why we used the data test in the first place). Also, if we want more than a smoke test, we would probably instead want to split it into a minibatch test and a validation test, no? Otherwise it will be unclear.

I was under the impression that we only wanted a smoke test though, and that the checking I was doing with test/data was OK, hence why we decided to put both minibatch and validation together in the same test case--correct me if I'm wrong.

Thanks!
